decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw. By using cards like Force of Negation, Spell Pierce, and Galvanic Discharge to disrupt the opponent's plays, while also utilizing Faithless Looting and Deep Analysis to dig through the deck for key cards. The win condition comes from playing powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and utilizing Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Kiora, the Rising Tide to control the board. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through strong control elements and efficient card advantage.

This deck focuses on using ramp cards and mana acceleration to quickly cast Eldrazi creatures, including powerful titans like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also includes spells like Kozilek's Return and All Is Dust to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By quickly ramping into large threats and controlling the battlefield, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing disruptive creatures like Tidehollow Sculler and Skyclave Apparition, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, you can slow down your opponent's strategy. Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play quickly, while Ephemerate provides extra value from enter-the-battlefield effects. Recruiter of the Guard helps you find key creatures for your game plan, while Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide strong finishers. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while also providing flexibility for your spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures, while also using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and Kozilek's Command provide control options, while Utopia Sprawl and Talismans help accelerate mana production. The deck includes a variety of Eldrazi creatures, such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, to dominate the late game and overwhelm the opponent. By combining ramp and control elements, this deck aims to establish a strong board presence and dictate the pace of the game.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature plays and quick damage output. Utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent early in the game. Cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory help to lock down the opponent's options while Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and damage potential. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to quickly defeat the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach alongside Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station to repeatedly cast and sacrifice artifacts from the graveyard, creating a loop that can eventually lead to a win condition such as Grapeshot. The deck aims to efficiently dig through the deck with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Preordain, while also generating mana with cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble. Urza's Saga can also help tutor for key pieces of the combo, leading to quick and explosive wins in the Modern format.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana through rituals and mana spells like Manamorphose and Desperate Ritual, then chain together spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Ral, Monsoon Mage to draw through the deck and eventually cast Past in Flames to replay all the previously used spells, allowing for explosive turns and potentially winning the game in one go. The inclusion of cards like Birgi, God of Storytelling and Wish add flexibility and extra resource generation to the combo.

The primary strategy of this deck revolves around using Amulet of Vigor to untap your lands and play Primeval Titan or Dryad of the Ilysian Grove early in the game. This allows you to ramp up your mana quickly and search for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to your opponent. With the combination of bounce lands and utility lands like Urza's Saga, you can generate a lot of value and create a powerful board presence. The goal is to assemble your combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm your opponent with a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play powerful spells with Cascade abilities, such as Shardless Agent, to put massive creatures like Scion of Draco onto the battlefield for free. The deck utilizes Leyline cards to enhance its spells and protect against opposing strategies while maintaining a low curve to consistently apply pressure to the opponent. The goal is to flood the board with creatures and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize, utilizing aggressive tactics and card advantage to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines the power of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Goblin Bombardment. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize to keep the opponent off balance. The mana base is consistent with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure the deck can cast its spells on curve. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The key concept of the deck is to flood the board with artifact creatures quickly using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, then use cards like Mystic Forge to draw through the deck and play additional threats. The deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient spells while taking advantage of the affinity mechanic to reduce costs. The inclusion of cards like Kozilek's Command and Ugin's Labyrinth provide additional utility and disruption to further push the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's plans while maintaining card advantage and control of the game. By utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard recursion with cards like Unearth and Cling to Dust, you aim to control the board state and outvalue your opponent. The deck also includes some efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus to close out the game once you have established control. Overall, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver your opponent in a battle of attrition.
